title: Field and Structure Imaging by Magnetic-field-free Atomic Resolution Scanning Transmission Electron Microscopy
content: Magnetic-field-free Atomic Resolution Scanning transmission electron microscope (MARS) is expected to be used for research and development of advanced magnetic materials and devices. In this microscope, a new magnetic objective lens system that realizes a magnetic field free environment at the sample position [1] is installed. Using this new objective lens system combined with the state-of-the-art higher order aberration corrector, atomic resolution TEM/STEM imaging under magnetic field free condition is now routinely possible.
